subject_terms_3: Religious life and practices  visual arts
physical_appearance: This is a pair of tear-shaped vessel. Both have a bulbous bottom, but while 001 tapers to a tip, 002 tapers to a spout. The hammered indentation at the centre of both however, are both hollow. Oxidisation appears to have occurred on 002.
sgcool_label_text:
This object is a ceremonial vessel possibly used for holy water.  It is tear-shaped with a small, hammered indentation at the centre. It is thought to be a symbol of the Great Goddess, the yoni (or vulva), and the indentation is thought to indicate the male counterpart, the god Shiva in the form of a linga (phallus). 

The goddess is the energy of the god, or his shakti. Her presence galvanises him into action. Therefore the combination of the male and female principal brings all things into being.
title_text: The Supreme Goddess as a pouring vessel symbol
subject_terms_2: Hindu bronzes  Religious articles  Hinduism Hindu gods
